main event: A circular object the size of a dime was spotted flashing red, green, and violet over North Dakota in 1958.
interesting points: The object was initially spotted 29 miles west of Crosby, North Dakota at an altitude of 10.5 miles.
The object moved to the west, then as the sun rose, it gained altitude until it disappeared.
The object remained visible for 35-45 minutes, from 9:35 AM to 11:05 AM.
The weather was clear and cool with a slight breeze, and visibility was unlimited.
The observer, 2/LT Michael Anaglerio, was an Intercept Controller and Senior Director, and had no possible explanation for the sighting.
sighted object: circular object the size of a dime, flashing red, green, and violet
location: 29 miles west of Crosby, North Dakota
witnesses: 2/LT Michael Anaglerio, Intercept Controller and Senior Director
photographs: yes, but no photograph present in this document
